etymologies: mid 16th century (denoting a list of words with definitions or translations): from medieval Latin vocabularius, from Latin vocabulum (see vocable)

definitions: the body of words used in a particular language.
shortDefinitions: body of words used in particular language

definitions: words used on a particular occasion or in a particular sphere

examples.text: the term became part of business vocabulary

shortDefinitions: part of such body of words used on particular occasion

definitions: the body of words known to an individual person
shortDefinitions: body of words known to individual person

definitions: a list of difficult or unfamiliar words with an explanation of their meanings, accompanying a piece of specialist or foreign-language text.
shortDefinitions: list of difficult or unfamiliar words with explanation of their meanings

definitions: a range of artistic or stylistic forms, techniques, or movements

examples.text: dance companies have their own vocabularies of movement

shortDefinitions: range of artistic or stylistic forms or movements
